result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Hobbs, Eric M
defendant.address: 12621 W Sycamore Drive #105, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:37 PM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Eric M Hobbs in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Eric M Hobbs.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Jensen provides an update; he has an offer and is requesting one more further proceedings for time to discuss the offer with his client.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Atty. Jensen makes a correction, he actually does not have the offer yet.  State notes there is not an offer in the file and will route the file to the ADA assigned to make sure an offer is prepared and sent to defense.  Court will still adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric M Hobbs in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Eric M Hobbs.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Jensen previously filed a motion to modify the conditions of bail to remove GPS monitoring.  Attorney Jensen makes arguments in support of his motion to modify the bail conditions.  Victim A appears in Court and states she does not object to the removal of GPS monitoring so long as the defendant continues to receive treatment.  The State responds to the request of the removal of GPS monitoring.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the motion and not make any modification to bail at this time.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing, filed by Attorney Jensen.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification filed by Atty. Jensen.  **Reviewed by Commissioner Costello 8/2/22 - to be addressed at the 8/10/22 Preliminary hearing.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

04:20 PM Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Eric M Hobbs did not appear.  The Court excused Defendant's appearance.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Court notes that the Defendant was presents, but due to the large calendar, the Court waives the Defendant's appearance.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Filed by Atty. Jensen.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Jeffrey Jensen as counsel of record for the defendant.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Laura Lau 06/27/2022.
Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A  (EXCEPTION: contact with victim A, through Our Family Wizard, for the SOLE purpose of the shared minor child) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS.  The defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day after being released.

01:55 PM Defendant Eric M Hobbs in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
